alert.note: Alert for Southeastern St. Lawrence; Southwestern St. Lawrence (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 05 at 2:42PM EST until January 06 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 7 PM EST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Lake effect snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 7 inches. * WHERE...Southern St. Lawrence County, mainly along and south of US Route 11 and New York Route 3. * WHEN...From midnight tonight to 7 PM EST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning and evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A area of lake effect snow will form tonight and persist through the day on Thursday bringing moderate to heavy snowfall to southern St. Lawrence County. Snowfall rates up to 1 inch per hour may be possible in the most intense snowfall. Greatest accumulations will be south of Route 3. Snowfall will gradually lessen Thursday evening as this band moves south out of the area.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Please allow extra time if travel is necessary.

area.areaDesc: Southeastern St. Lawrence; Southwestern St. Lawrence
